WHITINs are a good alternative to more expensive barefoot shoe brands. The sole is thin, and the insole has appropriate cushioning for casual walking. They are very comfortable, especially if you are trying to widen your toe base.  The material feels sturdy.
Whiten has become our go to shoe of its type. We have found them to fit better and last longer than much more expensive brands such as VIVO, barefoot, and zero..

I've been a big fan of the zero drop, wide toe box shoes that Whitin sells up until this shoe.  With arthritis in my lower back and hips, the Whitin shoes correct my posture and eliminate a lot of the pressure on my lower back created by other shoes.  I can make it though the day with minimal OTC pain meds and sleep better at night since I'm not experiencing inflammation all day.  So, I bought these slip-on's to wear around the house and in my shop.  These are absolutely not like the other Whitin shoes I get.  They fit horribly, squeezing your arch like it's tied with a rubber band and after two hours of wearing then on concrete I couldn't walk and spent the rest of the night in back and hip pain.  These are junk.

Very good barefoot shoes, especially for the price. The fore foot is truly widened as it should be for a barefoot shoe. In normal shoes I wear a woman's 11.5 extra wide. The 10s (mens sizing) fit well. They do tend to stretch/buldge out a little latterly at the foot opening but it's in no way a deal breaker. The foot bed is removable for washing which is appreciated. I have washed both full pairs of shoes twice so far with no ill effects.

评论概述: Wish this elastic collar version was avialble in other colors in 7W
评论详情: I am a woman and have wide feet from wearing barefoot shoes.  Going barefoot was the best decision I ever made after years of orthotics and plantar fasciitis.  I followed the advice of a physical therapist friend who said the issues I had were from wearing the "stabalizing" shoes and as a result my feet were weak and unable to mechanically function as intended.  He was right.  These are the most comfortable minimalist barefoot shoe I own.  I have this elastic collar slip on in a couple of colors.  I really want it in white, blue and khaki.  Unfortunately, they don't offer the eleastic collar version in my size in those colors.  I will keep checking but for now I am SOL.  Regardless...this is my favorite daily shoe.  I pair them with flat socks and they are super comfortable.  I always coat them with a canvas sealer to keep them clean as soon as I get them.  Anyway, I am thankful to have found them.  Highly recommend.
I have had flat feet with chronic pain for a while now. Since wearing these shoes have had no pain. Plenty of room for my feet and a have a great fit!

评论概述: Pretty good, cheap, sort of barefoot shoes
评论详情: With the insoles in, these are a bit stiff and don’t have as much space in the toe box as I expected. Other reviews suggested taking the insoles out, and this helped both of those issues quite a bit, although it’s now a bit loose near the top of the upper with the elastic. These are a good price for someone wanting to try barefoot shoes, although the other Whitin shoes I have with laces seem to be more comfortable and a better fit. The tongue also doesn’t appear to sit perfectly flat like it does in the pictures, but I’m a bit OCD and could just be nitpicking. These aren’t my favorite barefoot shoes I’ve tried, but they’re a solid deal for the price for a lightweight casual barefoot experience (without the insole, with is just a flat lightweight shoe that happens to look like it has a wide toe box)

评论概述: Good value for around the house
评论详情: I wanted something with zero drop and wide toebox to wear around the house for foot health.  I spend a lot of time in running shoes and most of those have a 6 to 10 mm drop and narrower toe box which squinches the toes together.  This gradually contributes to deformities like hammertoes, bunions etc.  I still use traditional expensive running shoes with cushioning and drop but not around house or for  errands etc... just for running.  I use Altra shoes for (zero drop and wide toebox) for walking, errands etc.  I usually wear sz 12 running shoes so I got sz 13 in the Whitin shoes as 12.5 was not offered and I wanted something wide enough for around the house shoes.  The 13s were a bit too wide but ok if wearing thicker socks  I can also wear toe spacers in them when I want.  The sz 13 Whitin weighs 336 g which is not that light and similar to running shoes in sz 12.  These are a great value for my purposes... not super comfortable but not supposed to be.

评论概述: Like Vans, but without the blisters and squished toes
评论详情: I have always loved slip-ons and was an avid Vans user in my youth, but my wide feet have always suffered in them. This gives me the look and feel of them without my toes getting squished. They are also very flexible and have a bit of cushioning in the back which helps avoid heel blisters. All in all I am a huge fan and plan on getting them in white soon. I am a women’s 9 - 9.5 and size 8 (41) fit perfectly. Make sure to use their sizing chart for a good fit.

评论概述: Worn these every day. They are fantastic.
评论详情: They are my favorite shoe/slip ons. I've worn these every day since I received them. My feet have become stronger/more flexible. Wider and able to breath. I've washed them in the clothes washer multiple times. Feels great with and without socks. Has not missed a beat - no extreme wear yet either and no signs of giving up. 11/10 would be more.

I don't think I'd take these out all day if I'm gonna be on my feet the entire time, but so far they've been great for running errands. They are very lightweight, so I don't know how they'll hold up under harsh wear and tear. I normally wear a 9.5 EEEE and these are just about perfect in the toe box. I don't feel my toes squished together or wedged into to a pointed toe end. They are a bit plain looking at them from the top and a little loose around the ankle (for my feet), but at this price, nothing serious to complain about. I may consider another pair later!

i love these shoes. im not limping to my car after work anymore or dealing with swollen feet on my day off. im giving 4 stars because they squeak super loud like you're on a basketball court which can get annoying if you're trying to remain low-key during your shift. no more sneaking around, but at least my feet don't hurt!
I just use these for my around-the-house shoes.  Lightweight and minimalist.  Comfortable enough.  The one problem I have is when I slip them on, the tounge rolls under a bit.

They fit well and are comfortable right out of the box. The instep is a little tighter than I like but it’s not bad. I prefer wearing them without the provided inserts to get better ground feel. I can recommend these and I anticipate buying another pair when these wear out.
